channel.title: Midi into Axoloti
channel.description: I have attached a patch I ade that is just selecting different oscillators, and I want to control the pitch and tempo using the external sequencer software from norns. Axoloti shows up as being recognized, but I am unsure how to attached a midi/in or makenote object in order to make the axoloti receive the midi messages. Maybe I am way off on how to do this but any feedback would be greatly appreciated!My Dreams Travel Wandering .axp (24.9 KB)

item.title: Midi into Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @servandisco servando barreiro
item.description:
@servandisco wrote:

subtle Fm might be your cup of tea.. Try reproducing this:
you could also add an envelope and the Vca (even in the feedback path.)
then you can add a tape delay + a reverb at the end and you are in Sine ambient heaven..

Screen Shot 2021-06-02 at 2.55.58 PM.png1069x504 45.4 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Midi into Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @dungeontroll666 Spencer J Salmon
item.description:
@dungeontroll666 wrote:

Thanks! I will try this out asap, I assumed I needed a different object than the keyboard one so that is super helpful to know.

I am trying to understand how to better build just soft sine wave ambient synth tones, but cannot seem to find examples that match a more modular sort of wiring. Could I ask you politely if you have any advice on those other connections with gates and vca?

Read full topic

item.title: Midi into Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @servandisco servando barreiro
item.description:
@servandisco wrote:

I guess What you need is the midi/in/keyb object
That will get midi notes from norns.
note goes directly to pitch, gate goes to trig an envelope that might control a Vca and Velocity could be an attenuator (*1) of that envelope output or could also modulate other parameters.
cheers

Read full topic
